definition: guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither

sentences.english: Among the differences was the wire inside his instrument.
sentences.chinese: 其中的一个不同就是他钢琴内部的琴丝。

sentences.english: Gina bought the piano at a low price.
sentences.chinese: 吉娜以低价买了这台钢琴。

sentences.english: The third section is on the values of Chen Peixun's Piano Music works.
sentences.chinese: 第三节，陈培勋钢琴音乐作品的价值体现。

sentences.english: Generally speaking , the most pianists all accepted the professional training in the year one.
sentences.chinese: 大凡钢琴家都在早年接受过专业训练。

sentences.english: "Piano lessons, " I tell Kevin. "Same as last year. "
sentences.chinese: “学钢琴”，我报告凯文，“和客岁同样”。

sentences.english: That class increased her accomplishments as a pianist.
sentences.chinese: 那个培训班增长了她作为钢琴师的技艺。

sentences.english: Part of your audience wants to see the pianist and presenter.
sentences.chinese: 一部分观众想要看到钢琴演奏者和演示者。

sentences.english: Speaking French and playing the piano are social graces.
sentences.chinese: 讲法语和弹钢琴是社交界的两大风雅。

sentences.english: The pianist made a conquest of every audience for which she played.
sentences.chinese: 这位钢琴家以她的演奏征服了每一位听众。

sentences.english: Li Yundi's piano performance is really fantastic. ;
sentences.chinese: 李云迪的钢琴表演实在是太出色了。

sentences.english: One of my all-time favorite jazz pianists is Thelonious Monk.
sentences.chinese: 瑟隆尼亚斯孟克是我其中一个最爱的爵士乐钢琴家。

sentences.english: Students will Participate piano grade examination stage 8-10.
sentences.chinese: 参加八到十级钢琴考试。

sentences.english: He then mastered the harmonica and the piano .
sentences.chinese: 接着，他又掌握了口琴和钢琴。

sentences.english: The Coda features the tune combined with an evocative countermelody in the piano.
sentences.chinese: 结尾部分的特征在于结合了钢琴的对位旋律。

sentences.english: The piano is a keyboard instrument with a history of over 200 years.
sentences.chinese: 钢琴是一种键盘乐器，其历史在二百年以上。

definition: zither or guzheng/large zither with 13 to 25 strings, developed from guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] during Tang and Song times
instrument of the violin family (violin, viola, cello or double bass)/CL:把[ba3]
